inclusion.criterion: parent/legal guardian and subject must be able to speak and understand English
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patient must be willing and able to give assent to take part in the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: diagnosed with asthma for at least 6 months
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: able to demonstrate inhalation technique with study device
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: if taking inhaled corticosteroids, dose must be stable for 2 weeks
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: no significant concomitant medical conditions or abnormal physical findings on screening except for those consistent with asthma and allergic rhinitis
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: airway responsiveness to methacholine with a baseline provocational dose causing an increase of at least 40% in R5 (PC40R5) at no more than 8 mg/mL
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: past or present history of any allergic reaction to any of the medications or formulations administered in this study
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: prior treatment with systemic corticosteroids in last 30 days or more than 4 courses in previous 12 months
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: use of short-acting beta-agonist more than two times per week in the previous month
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: change in dosage of inhaled corticosteroids in previous 30 days, nasal steroids in previous 15 days and montelukast in last 7 days
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has a history of asthma for 3 years and uses inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) and fluticasone 500 mcg/salmeterol 50 mcg. However, he recently doubled his oral corticosteroids in the past week which may be a concern.
